title: Fury from the Deep
dialogue_triumphs: It's down there. In the darkness. In the pipeline. Waiting.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Can hover, float, and take off like a rocket. Contains a laboratory.

continuity_notes.name: Sonic Screwdriver
continuity_notes.description: Multipurpose tool used by the Doctor
continuity_notes.current_status: First appearance in this story, used to open a release valve on an outlet pipe.

continuity_notes.name: U4
continuity_notes.description: A drug used as a neural stimulator

continuity_notes.name: Victoria Waterfield
continuity_notes.current_status: Decides to leave the TARDIS crew at the end of this story

roots: Victor Pemberton's 1966 radio play The Slide
links: Victoria mentions the Daleks, Cybermen, and Yeti from previous adventures

locations.name: Euro-Sea Gas Corporation refinery
locations.current_status: Operational, supplying all Euro-Sea gas for Wales and the south of England

additional_notes: The story features a plant monster and mind-controlling seaweed creatures. The Doctor struggles to fly a helicopter. The story has strong women characters, such as Megan Jones, and unusually has no deaths.
bottom_line: A real 'behind the sofa' job, but an unusual story, with strong women characters (Megan Jones) and no deaths.
